goal: Represent tiles with placed objects (cabin, wood shed, trees, furniture) plus visibility rules.
decisions: Introduce a tile object model (kind, size, supports surface/attachments) and keep terrain as separate ground data.
Place cabin/wood shed/trees as objects on tiles rather than special tile types; persist objects with their state.
Define size-based visibility: default near (1 tile), large objects (2), trees (3), cabin-scale (5).
plan: Add world object definitions and a per-tile/position object registry that can serialize with game state.
Update world generation/state init to spawn objects (cabin, wood shed, tree placeholders, basic surfaces) on tiles.
Refactor movement/look/examine/description to consume the object registry and apply new visibility ranges.
notes: Surfaces (e.g., table/wall) are objects that can hold items or attachments.
Legacy item interactions (inventory, fireplace) stay but are reached via their object instances.
